alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued April 12 at 2:40PM MDT until April 13 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 26 expected in the valley with readings of 30 to 32 being common in the Albuquerque heights. For the Wind Advisory, west winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from 2 AM to 9 AM MDT Wednesday. For the Wind Advisory, until 9 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops and other sensitive vegetation. Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs may be blown down. Expect strong cross winds on area roadways.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area
